estuary.model

Class ModelCountingGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • estuary.model.Game
      • estuary.model.ModelCountingGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tickable, GameFunctionality, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CountingTutorial

    public class ModelCountingGame
extends Game
    This is the second game. The user must find and select every crab before time runs out in order to win.
    Author:
    Matt
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModelCountingGame

        public ModelCountingGame(int difficulty)
        Initializes the elements of the game. Sets up the list of rocks and horseshoe crabs. Begins the countdown timer.
        Parameters:
        difficulty - used to determine number of crabs, rocks, and time to complete

      • ModelCountingGame

        public ModelCountingGame(int difficulty,
                         java.util.List<Rock> rocks,
                         java.util.List<HorseshoeCrab> horseshoeCrabs,
                         int count,
                         int score,
                         java.util.List<Barrier> border)
        Used for testing purposes Takes in externally-created lists of the game's elements
        Parameters:

        rocks -
        horseshoeCrabs -
        count - horseshoe crab count
        score -
        border -

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the game

      • initTimer

        public void initTimer()
        Initializes the timer

      • isEnd

        public boolean isEnd()
        The game ends if the every horseshoe crab is found, or when time runs out.
        Returns:
        a boolean of whether the game has ended or not

      • isEndScreen

        public void isEndScreen()
        Determines if the end screen should appear

      • handleCollisions

        public void handleCollisions()
        Handles the logic for the collions between all game entities. Horseshoe crabs cannot go through rocks or the border of the game.

      • onTick

        public boolean onTick()
        Handles all the logic for the frame-to-frame logic This includes moving entites and handling collisions.

      • onLeftAction

        public void onLeftAction(boolean pressed)
        Arrow keys do not do anything in this game.
        Parameters:
        pressed - boolean of whether the key is pressed or not
